name.description: The identifying name of the snap.

summary.description: A short description of the project. Maximum length 78 characters.

description.description: The full description of the project.

base.description: The base snap to be used as the run-time environment.

build-base.description: The baseline system that the snap is built in.

source-code.description: The links to the source code of the snap or the original product.

license.description: The project’s license as an SPDX expression.

contact.description: The snap author’s contact links and email addresses.

issues.description:
The links and email addresses for submitting issues, bugs, and feature
requests.

website.description: The links to the original software’s web pages.

icon.description: The path to the snap’s icon.

adopt-info.description:
Selects a part to inherit metadata from and reuse for the snap’s
metadata.

package-repositories.description: The APT package repositories to use as sources for build and stage packages.

grade.description: The quality grade of the snap.

confinement.description: The amount of isolation the snap has from the host system.

compression.description: Specifies the algorithm that compresses the snap.

layout.description: The file layouts in the execution environment.

passthrough.description: The attributes to pass to the snap’s metadata file.

assumes.description:
The minimum version of snapd and its features that the snap requires from the
host.

interface.description: The interface type for this plug/slot.

name.description: Well-known D-Bus name or content tag.

epoch.description: The epoch associated with this version of the snap.

system-usernames.description: The system usernames the snap can use to run daemons and services.

build-packages.description: The list of packages to install when building a snap.

build-snaps.description: The snaps to install when building a snap.

ua-services.description:
The Ubuntu Pro (formerly Ubuntu Advantage) services to enable when
building the snap.

provenance.description: The primary-key header for snaps signed by third parties.

parts.description: Part definitions for building the snap

interface.description: The interface type for this plug/slot.

name.description: Well-known D-Bus name or content tag.

listen-stream.description: The socket’s abstract name or socket path.

socket-mode.description: The mode or permissions of the socket in octal.

command-chain.description: The ordered list of commands to run before the hook runs.

environment.description: The environment variables for the hook.

plugs.description: The list of interfaces that the hook can connect to.

passthrough.description: The attributes to pass to the snap’s metadata file for the hook.

path.description: The file path, relative to the prime directory, being assigned permissions.

owner.description: The numeric user ID (UID) of the desired owner on the host system.

group.description: The numeric group ID (GID) of the desired owner group on the host system.

mode.description: The numeric representation of the file’s read, write, and execute permissions.

build-on.description: The architectures to build the snap on.

build-for.description: The target architecture for the build.

build-on.description: The architectures to build the snap on.

build-for.description: The target architecture for the build.

content.description: The name for the content type.

target.description: The path to where the producer’s files will be available in the snap.

default-provider.description: The name of the producer snap.

description.description: The multi-line description of the component.

adopt-info.description: Selects a part to inherit metadata from and reuse for the component’s metadata.

command.description: The command to run inside the snap when the app is invoked.

autostart.description: The desktop file used to start an app when the desktop environment starts.

common-id.description: The identifier to a desktop ID within an external appstream file.

bus-name.description: The bus name that the application or service exposes through D-Bus.

desktop.description: The desktop file used to start an app.

completer.description: The name of the bash completion script for the app.

stop-command.description: The command to run to stop the service.

post-stop-command.description: The command to run after the service is stopped.

start-timeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for the service to start.

stop-timeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for the service to stop.

watchdog-timeout.description:
The maximum amount of time the service can run without sending a
heartbeat to the watchdog.

reload-command.description: The command to run to restart the service.

restart-delay.description: The time to wait between service restarts.

timer.description: The time or schedule to run a service.

daemon.description:
Configures the app as a service, and sets its runtime and
notification behavior.

after.description: The ordered list of apps that the service runs after it launches.

before.description: The ordered list of apps that the service runs before it launches.

refresh-mode.description: Determines how the service should restart when the snap refreshes.

stop-mode.description: The signal to send when stopping the service.

restart-condition.description: The conditions that cause the service to restart.

success-exit-status.description: The list of additional successful exit statuses that the service can return.

install-mode.description: Whether snapd can automatically start the service when the snap is installed.

slots.description: The list of slots that the app provides.

plugs.description: The list of interfaces that the app can connect to.

aliases.description: The aliases that can be used to run the app.

command-chain.description:
The ordered list of commands to run before the app’s command
runs.

daemon-scope.description:
Determines whether the service is run on a system or a user instance of
systemd.

activates-on.description: The slots exposed by the snap to activate the service with D-Bus.

passthrough.description: The attributes to pass to the snap’s metadata file for the app.

extensions.description: The extensions to add to the project

Part.description: Part definition for building snap components

plugin.description: The plugin to build the part with.

after.description: The parts to process before starting this part’s build.

disable-parallel.description: Whether to disable CPU multithreading during the build step.

source.description: The location of the source files for the part.

source-type.description: The format of the part’s source.

source-checksum.description: The checksum of the downloaded source, to ensure integrity.

source-branch.description: If the source is a Git repository, this key specifies the target branch.

source-tag.description: If the source is a Git repository, this key specifies the target tag.

source-commit.description:
If the source is a Git repository, this key specifies the target commit.
Both short and long SHA hashes are supported.

source-depth.description:
If the source is a Git repository, this key specifies how far back in the
commit history to fetch.

source-submodules.description:
If the source is a Git repository, this key specifies the registered Git
submodules that the project also needs.

source-subdir.description: The subdirectory of the unpacked source where the build will occur.

override-pull.description: The commands to run instead of the default behavior of the pull step.

build-environment.description: The environment variables to define for the build step, as key-value pairs.

build-attributes.description: Special identifiers that change certain features and behavior during the build.

override-build.description: The commands to run instead of the default behavior of the build step.

build-packages.description:
The packages to install during the build step, before the build starts. The part
installs them into the build environment using the host’s native package manager.

build-snaps.description:
The snaps to install during the build step, before the build starts. The part
makes them available in the build environment.

organize.description:
A map of files from the build directory to their destinations in the stage
directory.

stage.description:
During the stage step, any specified files are copied from the build directory to
the stage directory.

stage-packages.description:
During the stage step, these packages are included in the stage environment
alongside the build artifacts.

stage-snaps.description: During the stage step, these snaps are included in the stage environment.

override-stage.description: The commands to run instead of the default behavior of the stage step.

prime.description:
During the prime step, any specified files are copied from the stage directory
to the final payload.

override-prime.description: The commands to run instead of the default behavior of the prime step.
